summary: This is a memorandum opinion and order by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, ruling on the government's motion to preclude the expert testimony of Dr. Ryan Hall. The court precludes Dr. Hall from testifying as an expert about his 2009 psychological evaluation of 'Alleged Victim 4' (a Jane Doe), finding the diagnoses irrelevant, remote in time, and unfairly prejudicial. The court reserves judgment on whether Dr. Hall could offer limited fact testimony.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, accused of involvement in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking scheme. The court order addresses the admissibility of expert testimony in her trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge for the Southern District of New York who authored the memorandum opinion and order, ruling on the admissibility of expert testimony.

persons.name: Ryan Hall
persons.context: A psychiatrist retained by Jeffrey Epstein in 2009 to evaluate 'Alleged Victim 4' in a civil suit. The defense sought to have him testify, but the court precluded his expert testimony on psychological diagnoses.

persons.name: Park Dietz
persons.context: One of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense, expected to rebut opinions of the government's expert, Dr. Lisa Rocchio. The government moved to partially preclude his testimony.

persons.name: Elizabeth Loftus
persons.context: One of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense, expected to rebut opinions of the government's expert, Dr. Lisa Rocchio. The government moved to partially preclude her testimony.

persons.name: Lisa Rocchio
persons.context: The government's expert witness whose opinions Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus were expected to rebut.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as having admitted liability for sexually abusing 'Alleged Victim 4' in a prior civil suit. Dr. Hall was retained by him to evaluate that victim.

persons.name: Susan Pope
persons.context: A prior mental health provider to 'Alleged Victim 4'. The defense indicated Dr. Hall would testify that the victim disclosed other sexual abuse to Dr. Pope but not abuse by Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case related to Epstein's sex trafficking scheme. The document references the indictment against her for conduct involving Epstein.
Dr. Hall was retained by Jeffrey Epstein to evaluate 'Alleged Victim 4' in connection with her civil suit against Epstein in 2009.
Dr. Hall conducted a psychological evaluation of 'Alleged Victim 4' in 2009, issuing a report with diagnoses and conclusions about her mental health and the impact of Epstein's abuse.

The document is part of Maxwell's trial where 'Alleged Victim 4' is a witness. A key point is that Dr. Hall's report noted the victim did not identify Maxwell as a perpetrator during his 2009 evaluation.
Dr. Dietz, a defense expert, was noticed to offer opinions rebutting those of the government's expert, Dr. Rocchio.
Dr. Loftus, a defense expert, was noticed to offer opinions rebutting those of the government's expert, Dr. Rocchio.

events.title: Psychological Evaluation of Alleged Victim 4
events.description: Dr. Ryan Hall evaluates 'Alleged Victim 4' and issues a report with psychological diagnoses. He concludes Epstein's conduct was responsible for '0-5%' of her total psychiatric picture.

events.title: Defense Notices Expert Witnesses
events.description: The defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case notices eight expert witnesses, including Dr. Ryan Hall, Dr. Park Dietz, and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus.

events.title: Government Moves to Preclude Dietz and Loftus
events.description: The government files a motion to partially preclude the testimony of defense experts Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus.

events.title: Government Moves to Preclude Six Experts
events.description: The government moves to fully or partially preclude the testimony of the remaining six defense experts, including Dr. Ryan Hall.

events.title: Court Precludes Dr. Hall's Expert Testimony
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order granting the government's motion to preclude Dr. Ryan Hall from offering expert testimony about his 2009 evaluation of 'Alleged Victim 4'.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court precluded defense expert Dr. Ryan Hall from testifying about his 2009 psychological diagnoses of 'Alleged Victim 4', finding the 12-year-old report too remote, irrelevant to credibility, and unfairly prejudicial under Federal Rules of Evidence 401, 403, and 702.

Dr. Hall's report diagnosed the victim with narcissistic personality disorder, borderline personality disorder, oppositional defiant disorder, depression, bulimia, and polysubstance abuse, and concluded Epstein's abuse accounted for only '0-5%' of her psychiatric issues.
A key factual point noted in the document is that during Dr. Hall's 2009 evaluation, 'Alleged Victim 4' did not identify Ghislaine Maxwell as a perpetrator of any abuse.

The court ruled that the defense could cross-examine 'Alleged Victim 4' about her substance use but could not admit Dr. Hall's expert diagnosis of addiction, following Second Circuit precedent distinguishing cross-examination from formal expert testimony.

The court reserved judgment on whether Dr. Hall could offer limited fact testimony (e.g., that the victim did not name Maxwell) as a potential prior inconsistent statement, depending on how the victim testified at trial.
